p.span: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the US Core Server actor when conforming to the US-Core IG The statement includes the complete list of actual profiles, RESTful operations, search parameters supported by US Core Servers. US Core Requesters have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

ol.li: Support the US Core Patient resource profile.
Support at least one additional resource profile from the list of US Core Profiles
Implement REST behavior according to the FHIR specification
Support json resource formats for all US Core interactions.
Identify the US Core profile(s) supported as part of the FHIR Meta profile attribute for each instance.
Declare a CapabilityStatement identifying the list of profiles, operations, search parameter supported.
Support xml resource formats for all US Core interactions.
Implement the security.html security requirements documented in the US-Core IG.
A server has ensured that every API request includes a valid Authorization token, supplied via: Authorization: Bearer {server-specific-token-here}
A server has rejected any unauthorized requests by returning an HTTP 401 Unauthorized response code.

p.span: interactions for the US Core Profiles the server chooses to support.
interactions for the US Core Profiles the server chooses to support.
Summary of US Core Profile search criteria. Specific server search capabilities are described in detail below in each of the resource sections.

td.span: US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-patient

ul.li: A server is capable of returning a patient using GET [base]/Patient/[id].
A server returns valid FHIR Patient resources according to the Data Access Framework (DAF) Patient Profile..

A server has exposed a FHIR Patient search endpoint supporting at a minimum the following search parameters:
identifier

A server has exposed a FHIR Patient search endpoint supporting at a minimum the following search parameters when at least 2 (example name and gender) are present:
name
gender
birthdate

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-allergyintolerance

ul.li: A server is capable of returning a patient’s allergies using GET /AllergyIntolerance?patient=[id].

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-careplan

ul.li: A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s Assessment and Plan of Treatment information using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan.

li.p: A server is capable of returning a patient’s Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&date=[date].

ul.li: A server SHOULD be capable returning all of a patient’s active Assessment and Plan of Treatment information using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&status=active.

li.p: A server SHOULD be capable returning a patient’s active Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&status=active&date=[date].

td.p: The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-careteam

ul.li: A server is capable of returning a patient’s current care team members using GET[base]/CareTeam?patient=[id]&status=active

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-condition

li.p: A server is capable of returning a patient’s conditions list using GET/Condition?patient=[id].

ul.li: A server SHOULD be capable returning all of a patient’s active problems and health concerns using ‘GET /Condition?patient=[id]&clinicalstatus=active,recurrance,remission’

li.p: A server SHOULD be capable returning all of a patient’s problems or all of patient’s health concerns using ‘GET /Condition?patient=[id]&category=[problem|health-concern]’

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-device

ul.li: A server is capable of returning all Unique device identifier(s)(UDI) for a patient’s implanted device(s) using GET /Device?patient=[id].

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-device

ul.li: A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s goals using GET [base]/Goal?patient=[id].
A server is capable of returning all of all of a patient’s goals over a specified time period using GET [base]/Goal?patient=[id]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

td.p: The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-immunization

ul.li: A client has connected to a server and fetched all immunizations for a patient using GET /Immunization?patient=[id].

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport

ul.li: A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB.

A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category code and date range using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

li.p: A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category and code using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&code=[LOINC].

A server SHOULD be capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category and one or more codes and date range using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&code=[LOINC1{,LOINC2,LOINC3,…}]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

td.p: The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-location

ul.li: A server is capable of returning a location by name using GET [base]/Location?name=[string]
A server is capable of returning a location by address using GET [base]/Location?address=[string]

li.p: The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. If the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest, then the READ and SEARCH Criteria SHALL be supported.

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationstatement

li.p: The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but IF the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the include parameter for searching this element. The client application must support both methods.

ul.li: A server is capable of returning a patient’s medications using one of or both

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest

li.p: The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but if the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the include parameter for searching this element. The client application must support both methods.

ul.li: A server is capable of returning a patient’s medications using one of or both

ol.li:
Resource Type:
Observation
Supported Profiles:
US Core Result Observation Profile
US Core Vital Signs Profile
US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile
.
Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-observationresults
A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory.
A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category code and date range usingGET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category and code using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&code=[LOINC].
A server SHOULD be capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category and one or more codes and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&code=[LOINC1{,LOINC2,LOINC3,…}]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-smokingstatus
A server is capable of returning a a patient’s smoking status using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code=72166-2
Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-vitalsigns
A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s vital signs that it supports using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=vital-signs.
A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s vital signs queried by date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=vital-signs&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
A server is capable of returning any of a patient’s vital signs queried by one or more of the codes listed below using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code[vital sign LOINC{,LOINC2,LOINC3,…}].
A server SHOULD be capable of returning any of a patient’s vital signs queried by one or more of the codes listed below and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code=[LOINC{,LOINC2…}]vital-signs&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
Search Parameters:
Conformance
Parameter
Type
Modifiers
SHALL
patient
reference
SHALL
category
token
SHALL
code
token
SHALL
date
date
The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile
Supported Search Combinations: patient + category , patient + category + date , patient + category + code , patient + category + code + date

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-organization

ul.li: A server is capable of returning an organization by identifier using GET [base]/Organization?identifier=[system]|[code]
A server is capable of returning an organization by name using GET [base]/Organization?name=[string]
A server is capable of returning an organization by address using GET [base]/Organization?address=[string]

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-practitioner

ul.li: A server is capable of returning a practitioner by identifier using GET [base]/Practitioner?identifier=[system]|[code]
A server is capable of returning a practitioner by name using GET [base]/Practitioner?family=[string]&given=[string]

p.strong: Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-procedure

ul.li: A server is capable of returning a patient’s procedures using GET/Procedure?patient=[id].
A server is capable of returning all of all of a patient’s procedures over a specified time period using GET /Procedure?patient=[id]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

td.p: The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile

publisher.value: Health Level Seven International (US Realm Steering Committee)

description.value: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the US Core Server actor when conforming to the US-Core IG The statement includes the complete list of actual profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by US Core Servers. US Core Clients have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

display.value: US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile

documentation.value:
The US Core Server SHALL:

  1. Support the US Core Patient resource profile.
  2. Support at least one additional resource profile from the list of US Core Profiles
  3. Implement REST behavior according to the FHIR specification
  4. Support json resource formats for all US Core interactions.
  5. Identify the US Core profile(s) supported as part of the FHIR Meta profile attribute for each instance.
  6. Declare a CapabilityStatement identifying the list of profiles, operations, search parameter supported.

The US Core Server SHOULD:

  1. Support xml resource formats for all US Core interactions.

description.value:
US Core Servers SHALL

  1. Implement the security requirements documented in the US-Core IG.
  2. A server has ensured that every API request includes a valid Authorization token, supplied via: Authorization: Bearer {server-specific-token-here}
  3. A server has rejected any unauthorized requests by returning an HTTP 401 Unauthorized response code.

documentation.value:
Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-patient

  • A server is capable of returning a patient using GET [base]/Patient/[id].
  • A server returns valid FHIR Patient resources according to the Data Access Framework (DAF) Patient Profile..
  • A server has exposed a FHIR Patient search endpoint supporting at a minimum the following search parameters:
    • identifier
  • A server has exposed a FHIR Patient search endpoint supporting at a minimum the following search parameters when at least 2 (example name and gender) are present:
    • name
    • gender
    • birthdate
Allows discovery of existing US Core patient resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core patients by id
Allows review of changes to US Core patient instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core patient instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-allergyintolerance

  • A server is capable of returning a patient’s allergies using GET /AllergyIntolerance?patient=[id].
Allows discovery of existing US Core AllergyIntolerance resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core AllergyIntolerance by id
Allows review of changes to US Core AllergyIntolerance instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core AllergyIntolerance instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-careplan

  • A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s Assessment and Plan of Treatment information using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan.

  • A server is capable of returning a patient’s Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&date=[date].

  • A server SHOULD be capable returning all of a patient’s active Assessment and Plan of Treatment information using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&status=active.

  • A server SHOULD be capable returning a patient’s active Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using GET /CarePlan?patient=[id]&category=assess-plan&status=active&date=[date].
Allows discovery of existing US Core careplan resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core careplan by id
Allows review of changes to US Core careplan instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core careplan instance
The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-careteam

  • A server is capable of returning a patient’s current care team members using GET[base]/CareTeam?patient=[id]&status=active
Allows discovery of existing US Core careteam resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core careteam by id
Allows review of changes to US Core careteam instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core careteam instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-condition

  • A server is capable of returning a patient’s conditions list using GET/Condition?patient=[id].

  • A server SHOULD be capable returning all of a patient’s active problems and health concerns using ‘GET /Condition?patient=[id]&clinicalstatus=active,recurrance,remission’

  • A server SHOULD be capable returning all of a patient’s problems or all of patient’s health concerns using ‘GET /Condition?patient=[id]&category=[problem|health-concern]’
Allows discovery of existing US Core condition resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core condition by id
Allows review of changes to US Core condition instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core condition instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-device

  • A server is capable of returning all Unique device identifier(s)(UDI) for a patient’s implanted device(s) using GET /Device?patient=[id].
Allows discovery of existing US Core device resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core device by id
Allows review of changes to US Core device instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core device instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-device

  • A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s goals using GET [base]/Goal?patient=[id].
  • A server is capable of returning all of all of a patient’s goals over a specified time period using GET [base]/Goal?patient=[id]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
Allows discovery of existing US Core Goal resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core Goal by id
Allows review of changes to US Core Goal instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core Goal instance
The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-immunization

  • A client has connected to a server and fetched all immunizations for a patient using GET /Immunization?patient=[id].
Allows discovery of existing US Core immunization resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core immunization by id
Allows review of changes to US Core immunization instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core immunization instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport

  • A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB.
  • A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category code and date range using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

  • A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category and code using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&code=[LOINC].

  • A server SHOULD be capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category and one or more codes and date range using GET [base]/DiagnosticReport?patient=[id]&category=LAB&code=[LOINC1{,LOINC2,LOINC3,…}]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
Allows discovery of existing US Core diagnosticreport resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core diagnosticreport by id
Allows review of changes to US Core diagnosticreport instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core diagnosticreport instance
The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-location

  • A server is capable of returning a location by name using GET [base]/Location?name=[string]
  • A server is capable of returning a location by address using GET [base]/Location?address=[string]
Allows discovery of existing US Core location resources using different search criteria.
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core location instance
Allows review of changes to US Core Medication instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core Medication instance

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. If the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest, then the READ and SEARCH Criteria SHALL be supported.
IF the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest. Allows discovery of existing US Core Medication resources using different search criteria.
IF the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest. Allows retrieval of a specific US Core Medication by id
Allows review of changes to US Core Medication instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core Medication instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationstatement

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but IF the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the include parameter for searching this element. The client application must support both methods.

  • A server is capable of returning a patient’s medications using one of or both
  1. GET /MedicationStatement?patient=[id]
  2. GET /MedicationStatement?patient=[id]&_include=MedicationStatement:medication
Allows discovery of existing US Core medicationstatement resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core medicationstatement by id
Allows review of changes to US Core medicationstatement instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core medicationstatement instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but if the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the include parameter for searching this element. The client application must support both methods.

  • A server is capable of returning a patient’s medications using one of or both
  1. GET /MedicationRequest?patient=[id]
  2. GET /MedicationRequest?patient=[id]&_include=MedicationRequest:medication
Allows discovery of existing US Core medicationrequest resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core medicationrequest by id
Allows review of changes to US Core medicationrequest instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core medicationrequest instance

.

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-observationresults

A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory.
A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category code and date range usingGET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category and code using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&code=[LOINC].

A server SHOULD be capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category and one or more codes and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=laboratory&code=[LOINC1{,LOINC2,LOINC3,…}]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-smokingstatus

  • A server is capable of returning a a patient’s smoking status using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code=72166-2

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-vitalsigns

  • A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s vital signs that it supports using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=vital-signs.
  • A server is capable of returning all of a patient’s vital signs queried by date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&category=vital-signs&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.

  • A server is capable of returning any of a patient’s vital signs queried by one or more of the codes listed below using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code[vital sign LOINC{,LOINC2,LOINC3,…}].

  • A server SHOULD be capable of returning any of a patient’s vital signs queried by one or more of the codes listed below and date range using GET [base]/Observation?patient=[id]&code=[LOINC{,LOINC2…}]vital-signs&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
Allows discovery of existing US Core results observation, smokingstatus, and vitals signs observation using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core results observation, smokingstatus, and vitals signs observation by id
Allows review of changes to US Core results observation, smokingstatus, and vitals signs observation over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core results observation, smokingstatus, and vitals signs observation instance
The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-organization

  • A server is capable of returning an organization by identifier using GET [base]/Organization?identifier=[system]|[code]
  • A server is capable of returning an organization by name using GET [base]/Organization?name=[string]
  • A server is capable of returning an organization by address using GET [base]/Organization?address=[string]
Allows discovery of existing US Core organization resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core organization by id
Allows review of changes to US Core organization instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core organization instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-practitioner

  • A server is capable of returning a practitioner by identifier using GET [base]/Practitioner?identifier=[system]|[code]
  • A server is capable of returning a practitioner by name using GET [base]/Practitioner?family=[string]&given=[string]
Allows discovery of existing US Core practitioner resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core practitioner by id
Allows review of changes to US Core practitioner instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core practitioner instance

Summary of US Core Search Criteria for StructureDefinition-us-core-procedure

  • A server is capable of returning a patient’s procedures using GET/Procedure?patient=[id].
  • A server is capable of returning all of all of a patient’s procedures over a specified time period using GET /Procedure?patient=[id]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}.
Allows discovery of existing US Core procedure resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core procedure by id
Allows review of changes to US Core procedure instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core procedure instance
The server SHALL support the date search modifiers ‘ge’,‘le’,‘eq’ for this profile
